COMPANY NEWS

COMPANY NEWS;TOKHEIM TO ACQUIRE GAS-STATION BUSINESS OF SOFITAM

June 26, 1996

See the article in its original context from

June 26, 1996 , Section D , Page 4Buy Reprints

TimesMachine is an exclusive benefit for home delivery and digital subscribers.

About the Archive

This is a digitized version of an article from The Times’s print archive, before the start of online publication in 1996. To preserve these articles as they originally appeared, The Times does not alter, edit or update them.

Occasionally the digitization process introduces transcription errors or other problems; we are continuing to work to improve these archived versions.

The Tokheim Corporation agreed yesterday to buy the gas-station business of Sofitam International for $108 million. Tokheim, based in Fort Wayne, Ind., makes gas-station equipment, including pumps and credit-card transactions systems in North America, Europe and Africa. The company said the acquisition would strengthen its position in southern and northern Europe and Africa. Sofitam, which is based in Paris, is owned by Compagnie Generale des Eaux, a French municipal services, telecommunications and construction company.

A version of this article appears in print on , Section D , Page 4 of the National edition with the headline: COMPANY NEWS;TOKHEIM TO ACQUIRE GAS-STATION BUSINESS OF SOFITAM. Order Reprints | Today’s Paper | Subscribe
